Elliotte Harold wrote:

>  >>> So you're recommending 100% code coverage?
>  >> Yes.
>  > That's not very realistic, is it?
> Only in a binary world. In the real, fuzzy world it's not a yes or no,
> 100% or 0%, situation. It's a case of more being better than less. You
> can asymptotically approach 100% coverage, even if you never quite get
> there.

I think this is exactly the sense in which the community has recommended 
100% coverage in the past. It's easy to show a counterexample 
(test-drive the happy path for invoking a method that throws a checked 
exception) for 100% coverage happening naturally from TDD, but I think 
it's a laudable "Shu-level" goal.

> I'll be hosting a panel at SD Best Practices in Boston next month with
> Bob Martin and Scott Ambler to talk about precisely these sorts of
> things. By the way, I'm still looking for one more panelist for this so
> if anyone's interested, please drop me a private e-mail.

I wish I could attend that one. I wish I could participate, even.
--
